flow.descriptionCdata:
42cc951d-1161-4343-a2fe-052c0cea09d9.04b4bbe3-446c-4915-8277-eab7bfb2c6ae.transition.description=at least one webpage could not be accessed. 42cc951d-1161-4343-a2fe-052c0cea09d9.115dfd70-4fca-490c-9d67-250785d2017b.description=
Service to perform an HTTP GET via the Java HTTP Client
42cc951d-1161-4343-a2fe-052c0cea09d9.1401baa8-cb41-4f40-a92d-ec6f24ea8540.description=
Sends an smtp email.
 
Inputs\:
    hostname - The hostname or ip address of the smtp server.
    port - The port smtp service is listening.
    from - From email address.
    to - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients.
    cc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the CC.
    bcc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the BCC.
    subject - The email subject. If a subject spans on multiple lines, it is formatted to a single one.
    body - The body of the email.
    htmlEmail - Default value is true. The value should be true if the email is in rich text/html format. The value should be false if the email is in plain text format.
    readReceipt - Default is false. The value should be true if read receipt is required, else false.
    attachments - A deliimiter separated list of files to attach (must be full path).
    username - If SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send.
    password - The password to use.
    characterSet - The character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is UTF-8.
    contentTransferEncoding - The content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is - quoted-printable or Q Encoding.
    delimiter - A delimiter to separate the email recipients and the attachments. This input defaults to ';' if left empty.
 
Responses\:
    success - Successfully sent the email.
    failure - Failed to send the email.

Note\:
1. For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
2. For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.
42cc951d-1161-4343-a2fe-052c0cea09d9.1668aecb-defa-41b5-b759-8e5ed1ba4122.prompt=To\: 42cc951d-1161-4343-a2fe-052c0cea09d9.1b1aef73-b7ea-4206-a398-5b00b112f2f6.prompt=HostName\: 42cc951d-1161-4343-a2fe-052c0cea09d9.315bb021-5a48-4837-b2d9-1bb68966442a.prompt=Enter a comma separated list of URLS to test. 42cc951d-1161-4343-a2fe-052c0cea09d9.43ddec60-dbb0-4bd1-8766-498b7544e972.transition.description=All webpages could be accessed. 42cc951d-1161-4343-a2fe-052c0cea09d9.558d13d5-e27d-43b4-89c2-8fc082398d8a.description=
Useful Op to keep a running results.
Takes a string input (resultText) and appends this to a global context key of "runningResults".

Input Parameters\:
keyName - name of context key to append to
resultText - string input to append
delimiter - (leave blank for none) the delimiter to put between what is already in keyName before appending resultText

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Context\:
runningResults

Scriptlet Example\:
currentResults \= scriptletContext.get("runningResults");

if (currentResults \=\= null) {
   currentResults \= resultText;
} else {
   currentResults +\= resultText;
}


scriptletContext.putGlobal("runningResults", currentResults);
42cc951d-1161-4343-a2fe-052c0cea09d9.59b09eb3-d1c8-4a8a-bba1-2b70be6da8c7.transition.description=Failure stored in memory 42cc951d-1161-4343-a2fe-052c0cea09d9.5d301039-a5ef-4c4c-a091-fa657ae39c2b.description=remembers that a failure has occurred, but allows the rest of the list to still be tested. 42cc951d-1161-4343-a2fe-052c0cea09d9.6152331b-75fd-4a50-9c08-c1bf8260542b.description=Checks to see if a failure has already occurred. 42cc951d-1161-4343-a2fe-052c0cea09d9.6b5dcbb0-dfc0-4738-b5b6-603ebbb40890.prompt=From\: 42cc951d-1161-4343-a2fe-052c0cea09d9.72db85f0-5b63-483f-9275-f79ea47e69a1.description=Iterates over list elements. 42cc951d-1161-4343-a2fe-052c0cea09d9.81c569c6-b1c6-4718-bec4-e0b65570a5a1.description=
Useful Op to keep a running results.
Takes a string input (resultText) and appends this to a global context key of "runningResults".

Input Parameters\:
keyName - name of context key to append to
resultText - string input to append
delimiter - (leave blank for none) the delimiter to put between what is already in keyName before appending resultText

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Context\:
runningResults

Scriptlet Example\:
currentResults \= scriptletContext.get("runningResults");

if (currentResults \=\= null) {
   currentResults \= resultText;
} else {
   currentResults +\= resultText;
}


scriptletContext.putGlobal("runningResults", currentResults);
42cc951d-1161-4343-a2fe-052c0cea09d9.8387dba7-fe86-4ff7-ae95-f4a8ccafbf94.prompt=To\: 42cc951d-1161-4343-a2fe-052c0cea09d9.9b68c1c8-b448-4e6a-83e2-238176962f0f.transition.description=There are more elements in the list. 42cc951d-1161-4343-a2fe-052c0cea09d9.aea1f552-f5c0-4d08-8542-8ef1a0c0c637.transition.description=Failure stored in memory 42cc951d-1161-4343-a2fe-052c0cea09d9.b19fb037-f14d-4663-92d8-f2cfd5fdf41b.prompt=From\: 42cc951d-1161-4343-a2fe-052c0cea09d9.be68e7d5-4046-4db8-9e9e-c0de3fad6344.description=
Sends an smtp email.
 
Inputs\:
    hostname - The hostname or ip address of the smtp server.
    port - The port smtp service is listening.
    from - From email address.
    to - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients.
    cc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the CC.
    bcc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the BCC.
    subject - The email subject. If a subject spans on multiple lines, it is formatted to a single one.
    body - The body of the email.
    htmlEmail - Default value is true. The value should be true if the email is in rich text/html format. The value should be false if the email is in plain text format.
    readReceipt - Default is false. The value should be true if read receipt is required, else false.
    attachments - A deliimiter separated list of files to attach (must be full path).
    username - If SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send.
    password - The password to use.
    characterSet - The character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is UTF-8.
    contentTransferEncoding - The content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is - quoted-printable or Q Encoding.
    delimiter - A delimiter to separate the email recipients and the attachments. This input defaults to ';' if left empty.
 
Responses\:
    success - Successfully sent the email.
    failure - Failed to send the email.

Note\:
1. For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
2. For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.
42cc951d-1161-4343-a2fe-052c0cea09d9.description=
Tests a list of URLS to make sure they are responding.

Inputs\:
    List - The list of URLS that will be tested.
    seperator - A separator that is placed between each url that is in the list (must not be in any of the URLs themselves...).
    username - A username to use when connecting to the URLs.
    password - A password to use when connecting to the URLs.
    email host - An SMTP host to send the email report on this test through.
    port - The port on that host that is running SMTP, default is 25.
    from - The email address the message will come from.
    to - The email message the message will be sent to.
    subject - The subject line of the email. This will have PASSED or FAILED added to the beginning of it.
    keyName - The name of a key that will be used for assembling the email.

Responses\:
    success - All URLs passed the test, and the email was successfully sent.
    failure - Something went wrong.
42cc951d-1161-4343-a2fe-052c0cea09d9.e00c70b4-2ce2-42ca-b6c8-0bd46a926e01.prompt=HostName\:
